meanings.definition: A waft or puff of air.
meanings.sent1: The waucht of wind rustled the leaves gently.
meanings.sent2: I felt a waucht of cool air as I opened the window.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten chased after the waucht of a passing breeze.
meanings.sent4: The waucht of laughter filled the room, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The waucht of perfume from the flowers was intoxicating.

meanings.definition: To blow or breathe out forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She waucht out the candles on her birthday cake with a big breath.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith waucht the bellows to make the fire burn hotter.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to waucht out the candles but ended up spitting everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His words waucht out of him in a rush of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The wind wauchted through the trees, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: A small amount or quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: She added a waucht of sugar to her tea.
meanings.sent2: There was just a waucht of paint left in the can.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a waucht of spice to the dish, giving it a kick.
meanings.sent4: A waucht of excitement filled the room as the surprise was revealed.
meanings.sent5: The waucht of perfume on the letter reminded her of him.
